title: AMs call for reduction in number of unadopted roads - BBC News
summary: plenary begins at 1.30pm with questions to the cabinet secretary for energy , planning and rural affairs .
questions to the cabinet secretary for finance .
member debate under standing order 11.21 ( iv ) - unadopted roads .
debate on the health , social care and sport committee 's report into loneliness and isolation .
short debate : getting smart with fuel poverty .

documents.title: hwyl
text: that 's it from the siambr for today .
senedd live returns after the spring half term recess .
@ jasonmohammad & @ twitterid will be looking at the future of the m4 on # waleslive tonight plus patrick jones asks if there are any great welsh orators left # waleslive 10.30pm - @ twitterid wales
no great welsh orators in politics but @ twitterid and @ twitterid are ace .

documents.title: 'getting smart with fuel poverty '
text: the topic chosen by mark isherwood ( north wales ) for his short debate is 'getting smart with fuel poverty ' .

documents.title: mental health motion passed
text: the welsh conservatives motion is passed , with 41 for and six against .

documents.title: mental health one of the five priority areas
text: health secretary vaughan gething reminds ams that mental health is one of the five priority areas of prosperity for all : the national strategy , recognising that `` getting the right treatment at an early stage , coupled with greater awareness of conditions , can in many cases prevent long term adverse impacts '' .

documents.title: 'number of episodes of panic attack '
text: david melding says he has had `` a number of episodes of panic attack and it is horribly debilitating .
`` it has a huge effect on your confidence '' .

documents.title: capacity of veterans ' nhs wales
text: darren millar focuses on the veterans ' nhs wales service , calling for additional funding to increase capacity .
each local health board has appointed an experienced clinician as a veteran therapist with an interest or experience of military mental health problems .

documents.title: inquiry into emotional and mental health of children and young people
text: lynne neagle , chair of the children , young people and education committee , points out that tomorrow the committee holds its final evidence session on the inquiry into the emotional and mental health of children and young people , and will report later this term .

documents.title: 'children who require treatment for mental health must receive it promptly '
text: rhun ap iorwerth presents his amendment to add a new point at the end of the motion , that the assembly `` ensures that children who require treatment for mental health receive it promptly before their condition gets worse and that the welsh government publishes statistics on performance against this objective '' .

documents.title: 'mental health services in wales could be world-leading '
text: `` mental health services in wales could be world-leading '' says angela burns `` if run in a more proactive , holistic manner '' .
she highlights the pressures on children and young adults , including the impact of social media .
she says mental health services are chronically underfunded .
great to hear @ twitterid mentioning # opendialogue in mental health debate .
incredibly positive outcomes and being implemented around the world so @ twitterid @ twitterid when will it happen in wales ?
i hope @ twitterid will surprise us both and talk about # opendialogue in his response
needs up front investment to train multi disciplinary teams but massive long term gains for people and public purse .
in finland over 70 % of people experiencing first episode psychosis return to work or education and live lives outside mental health system .
needs to happen here

documents.title: 'people with mental health conditions face injustices and challenges '
text: the topic chosen for the welsh conservatives debate is mental health .
the proposal is that the assembly :
recognises the importance of good mental health .
regrets that some people with mental health conditions face injustices and challenges when accessing services .
calls on the welsh government to ensure that wales 's health and social care sectors are able to deliver effective , preventative mental health services .

documents.title: recommendations accepted , at least partially
text: the minister for children and social care huw irranca-davies sets out the welsh government 's response to the report , which can be seen in detail here .
all the recommendations are accepted , at least partially .

documents.title: twitter responses to debate
text: great comments from @ twitterid who explains what loneliness and isolation means in a truly human way .
good to hear @ twitterid outline the need for us all to discuss more about loneliness and how we can all play our part .
@ twitterid talking about how older volunteering can help older people to make new friends
@ jfinchsaunders talking not only about the financial costs of loneliness .
but the impact on the quality of life for people .

documents.title: 'some policies in recent years have been going in a different direction '
text: lynne neagle , labour am for torfaen , welcomes the welsh government 's `` commitment to tackling loneliness as a national priority , but some policies in recent years have been going in a different direction '' .
she cites the axing of the communities first scheme .

documents.title: 'publish strategy before 2019 '
text: dai lloyd ( south wales west ) presents the report which has six recommendations .
the first recommendation is that the welsh government `` review the timescales for the development of its strategy to address loneliness and isolation , with a view to publication before 2019 '' .

documents.title: debate on the health , social care and sport committee 's report
text: we move on to a debate on the health , social care and sport committee 's report into loneliness and isolation .
how should we tackle loneliness and isolation ?
@ assemblywales to debate @ twitterid report in plenary today

documents.title: motion on unadopted roads is passed
text: the motion on unadopted roads is passed without objection .

documents.title: 'task-force to resolve this issue across our country '
text: economy secretary ken skates says the debate makes clear there is a `` problem that needs solving in wales '' .
he acknowledges the issue `` justifies a national approach to ensure a consistent approach across all authorities '' .
he says he has instructed officials to begin discussions with the welsh local government association ( wlga ) on the `` development of a task-force to resolve this issue across our country '' .

documents.title: 'disgraceful ' response from estate management company
text: hefin david says as well as unadopted roads , there is an issue with the way estate management companies work .
he quotes a response to a resident from an estate management company for cwm calon in his constituency , stating `` with respect , get a life '' .
he describes that response as `` absolutely disgraceful '' .

documents.title: sewers , roads or public open space
text: nick ramsay cites the website of the resident adoption action group , which sets out the issues facing residents who live on housing estates where the sewers , roads or public open space have not been adopted .

the action group states `` local councils are often also less than motivated in fulfilling their promise to the residents to adopt a site as they are already receiving 100 % of the council tax even though they are not maintaining your highway '' .

documents.title: 'informed and thoughtful contributions from all sides'labour am tweets
text: excellent debate in the senedd on unadopted roads .
not sexy perhaps but informed and thoughtful contributions from all sides calling for practical action by wg .
money ?

documents.title: 'cries out for reform '
text: david melding says he shares mr hedges ' anger that some developers have built roads on new estates that are not to adoptable standards , adding that the issue of unadopted roads `` cries out for reform '' .

documents.title: 'new roads should be built to adoptable standards '
text: `` all new roads should be built to adoptable standards , '' says mike hedges .

documents.title: 'quantifying the scale of the problem is difficult '
text: dai lloyd cites the example of an unadopted road in waunarlwydd which has proved problematic for decades .
he also says as local authorities are not obliged to maintain a register of unadopted roads , `` quantifying the scale of the problem is difficult '' .

documents.title: 'deliver a reduction in the number of unadopted roads '
text: the first debate of the day is a member debate on unadopted roads .
dai lloyd ( south wales west )
david melding ( south wales central
nick ramsay ( monmouth )
mike hedges ( swansea east )
supported by
vikki howells ( cynon valley )
propose that the national assembly for wales :
notes the number of roads in wales which are unadopted , and are therefore not maintained by the relevant local authority .
notes that a number of developers have not built roads on new estates to adoptable standards .

recognises that there are weaknesses in the house-buying process , which does not always ensure that buyers have sufficient financial retentions in place to bring these roads up to the local authority 's adoptable standard .
recognises that house buyers are often faced with having to invest significant sums of money in order to bring roads up to the local authority 's adoptable standard .
notes that many of these roads remain unadopted and in a bad state of repair , for a number of years , sometimes in perpetuity .

calls on the welsh government to establish a taskforce , to include local authorities , the legal profession , developers and other key stakeholders , with a view to developing improvements to the house buying and road adoption process .
seeks to develop a wales-wide programme to deliver a reduction in the number of unadopted roads in wales .

documents.title: motions to elect a member to committees
text: new am jack sargeant is elected to three assembly committees .

documents.title: 'absolutely fed-up '
text: joyce watson says `` i 'm absolutely fed-up of talking about case reviews where things have gone wrong through lack of joined-up thinking '' .

documents.title: expect powys council to 'expedite the necessary improvements '
text: huw irranca-davies , minister for children and social care , says the boy 's family and the welsh government `` would expect powys county council to expedite the necessary improvements to ensure the best care and support is always provided '' .

documents.title: death of a child in the care of powys county council
text: simon thomas raises the case of a teenager who took his own life while in foster care .
the teenager was failed by agencies as he prepared to leave the care system , a review has concluded .
the boy , from powys , killed himself three months before his 18th birthday after becoming anxious about living independently .
agencies failed to account for his special educational needs to ensure a smooth transition , the review said .
powys council apologised for failing to provide appropriate support for him .

documents.title: 'no deal outcome from brexit would be catastrophic for wales '
text: a `` no deal outcome from brexit would be catastrophic for wales , '' mark drakeford tells neil hamilton .
mr hamilton says such words are `` music to the ears '' of the eu 's chief brexit negotiator michel barnier because it makes his negotiating position stronger .

documents.title: call for fundamental review of procurement strategy
text: conservative nick ramsay calls for a fundamental review of the welsh government 's procurement strategy .

documents.title: percentage of welsh procurement in the public sector
text: adam price : `` is the percentage of welsh procurement in the public sector that you 're responsible for going up or down ? ''
mark drakeford : `` on the whole , it 's increasing . ''
adam price : `` no , it 's going down '' .

documents.title: 'seek to defeat the government so that we can amend the bill '
text: on the eu withdrawal bill , mark drakeford says `` if we ca n't get an agreed amendment with the uk government , we will pursue our own amendment in the house of lords and we will seek to defeat the government so that we can amend the bill in the way that is necessary '' .

documents.title: welsh government offices located outside of cardiff
text: we move on to questions to the cabinet secretary for finance , mark drakeford .
russell george asks about the future of welsh government offices located outside of cardiff .
he seeks assurance that the welsh government will maintain a long-term presence in newtown .
mr drakeford replies that `` with budgets under very significant pressure , we have to continually review the estate the welsh government occupies '' .

documents.title: mark reckless fails to ask his tabled question
text: the llywydd elin jones is unhappy that mark reckless is also not present in the siambr to ask his question , the second am from the conservative group to miss a question this afternoon .

documents.title: 'sense of proportion ' needed from natural resources wales
text: ukip 's neil hamilton calls for a `` sense of proportion '' in proposals from natural resources wales on salmon and sea trout fishing .
nrw has been consulting on whether all anglers should be forced to release every salmon they catch in a bid to stop a serious reduction of stocks in welsh rivers .

documents.title: package of measures dealing with animal welfare
text: conservative paul davies refers to the report un the knots : the case for a more cohesive approach to pet welfare legislation .
he wants to know what the government is doing to strengthen or introduce legislation regarding the sale of pets .
lesley griffiths says she will announce a package of measures dealing with animal welfare in march .

documents.title: ability for farmers to attract workforce from eu a 'huge issue '
text: questioned by plaid cymru 's simon thomas about a post-brexit framework for agriculture in wales , lesley griffiths says it would be `` a huge issue if there was a narrowing of the ability for farmers to attract workforce from the eu after brexit '' .

documents.title: enforcement powers delegated to natural resources wales
text: the first of the tabled questions is by angela burns who was due to ask for an outline of the enforcement powers delegated from the welsh government to natural resources wales .
but she was not present in the siambr so missed her chance to question the cabinet secretary .

documents.title: questions to lesley griffiths
text: plenary begins at 1.30pm with questions to the cabinet secretary for energy , planning and rural affairs , lesley griffiths .

documents.title: back at 1.30pm
text: the committee now moves into private session .
senedd live returns for plenary at 1.30pm .

documents.title: cost of £ 5971 per job in the enterprise zones
text: ken skates says welsh government investment in the enterprise zones has `` supported more than 10,700 jobs since 2012 , which equates to £ 5971 per job .
`` that is an incredible figure , '' he adds .

documents.title: 'not closing the door on the idea of an additional enterprise zone '
text: `` i 'm not closing the door on the idea of an additional enterprise zone , '' says mr skates , adding `` wrexham is often talked of as a place where an additional enterprise zone could be created '' .

documents.title: two zones in the north west with one governing board
text: plaid cymru 's adam price says there will be dissapointment in north wales at the changes .
mr skates says there will be two zones in the north west with one governing board , `` taking forward work in a co-ordinated fashion '' .

documents.title: four enterprise boards to cease
text: the deeside , ebbw vale , cardiff central , cardiff airport and st athan boards will cease , says mr skates .
scrapping enterprise zone boards will reduce costs , says @ twitterid boards will be closing later this year more :

documents.title: anglesey and snowdonia enterprise boards to merge
text: announcing changes to governance arrangements , the anglesey and snowdonia enterprise boards will be merging , says mr skates .

documents.title: port talbot and haven waterway boards to continue to july 2021
text: ken skates announces that the port talbot waterfront board and haven waterway board will continue for a further three years to july 2021 .

documents.title: scrutiny of the cabinet secretary for economy and transport
text: the committee moves on to scrutiny of the cabinet secretary for economy and transport .
attending with ken skates are :
duncan hamer , deputy director , entrepreneurship and delivery
mick mcguire , director , business and regions .

documents.title: 'lost opportunities because we have n't had available premises '
text: hefin david reminds the committee of previous evidence from chris sutton of property consultancy jll in cardiff , who told ams `` if you look across the whole of wales there are only perhaps two or three vacant industrial buildings '' of modern or 'grade a ' standard .
mark langshaw , chair of ebbw vale enterprise zone , agrees that is an issue , saying `` in blaenau gwent we 've lost opportunities because we have n't had available premises in specific sizes . ''

documents.title: only one person on apprenticeship scheme
text: asked by david rowlands about any failures , david jones replies that `` a shared apprenticeship scheme did n't work for us .
`` we ended up with only one person on it .
`` i think it 's because apprenticeships in deeside are so well developed and ingrained , we did n't need that programme to get it going '' .
deeside is the most successful enterprise zone in wales , where there was already a thriving business sector to build on .
toyota , one of the world 's biggest car manufacturers , has been operating there since 1992 , long before there was an enterprise zone .
it employs 650 people mainly in the production of electric hybrid engines .
one engine is assembled every 44 seconds at the site .

documents.title: 'comparing is difficult '
text: `` comparing enterprise zones is difficult and comparing with england is difficult , '' says david jones , chair of deeside enterprise zone .

documents.title: more regional approach to economic development ?
text: asked by vikki howells whether there is a need for a more regional approach to economic development , david jones , chair of deeside enterprise zone , says that is `` not at the forefront of my mind '' .

documents.title: 'not job done yet '
text: with a governance review underway , mark langshaw , chair of ebbw vale enterprise zone , says `` it 's not job done yet '' .

documents.title: chairs of the enterprise zone boards
text: the first two witnesses this morning are :
mark langshaw , chair , ebbw vale enterprise zone
david jones , chair , deeside enterprise zone .

documents.title: welcome to senedd live
text: bore da .
the economy , infrastructure and skills committee is today discussing enterprise zones .
almost 3,000 jobs have been created since enterprise zones were set up in 2012 with a £ 221m investment .
the economy committee has started an inquiry into their performance .
the welsh conservatives have questioned whether they provide value for money .
